intro: Erysimum divaricatum, commonly known as the clustered wallflower, is a herbaceous plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 centimeters and features bright yellow flowers with four petals. The plant has linear, grass-like leaves and thrives in well-drained soils. It is often found in rocky or gravelly habitats, particularly on slopes and in open woodlands. Erysimum divaricatum is known for its hardy nature and ability to bloom in early spring.
